result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dorene A Bray

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears in person and by Atty. Brian Borkowicz. Preliminary hearing requested but set out further due to defendant's medical situation.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Prosecuting Attorney Elizabeth A. Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dorene A. Bray in court and by Attorney Brian Michael Borkowicz.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion and Demand for Discovery and Inspection
No contact with any Washington County Walmart Stores

Prosecuting Attorney Stephanie L. Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears via video in custody from the Washington County Jail and by Atty. Timothy Drewa.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to be physically present at today's hearing and accepts consent to use of video conferencing.  Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant eligible for State Public Defender.  State requests cash bond.  $2,000 signature bond set.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing and to appear with counsel.
Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 09:45 am.
